description:
The sacraments
are sacred rites instituted by Christ through which divine grace
is conveyed to believers. Catholic and Orthodox Christianity recognize seven sacraments marking the journey of Christian life from
birth to death, while Protestant traditions typically observe two (Baptism and Eucharist). Each sacrament combines visible sign with
invisible grace, sacred matter with spiritual power, making the divine tangibly present in human experience.
name: Christian Tradition
